intro: Phlomoides zenaidae, commonly known as the Zenaida's phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
